text: b'Where are we headed post-COVID-19? Back to business as usual or forward to a more equitable world?\n\nFascinating discussion with @DrDaronAcemoglu about the interface between automation and inequality -- and what role technology will play. #RichardGoodeLecture https://t.co/sW7JyGu2Wf'

b'2021 must be the year we take advantage of a historic opportunity to switch gears toward a greener economy \xe2\x80\x94 and build resilience for the future. \n \nPleased to join my fellow members of the Global Commission on Adaptation to discuss its critical work. The IMF is doing our part! https://t.co/6iFw4UJkt9'

b"My experience tells me that in a crisis, we must act decisively and zero in on the most vulnerable. We have done that and will continue to do so.\n\nGreat conversation at today's Bloomberg 50 panel with @joelwebershow! https://t.co/F5FedO6QzP"

b'We can -- and we must -- fight the COVID-19 crisis and tackle climate change at the same time. \n \nHow?  A strong, coordinated, and green public investment push that drives a post-pandemic job-rich recovery.  My op-ed with @rajshah. https://t.co/VWOm1sDiyn'

b'We stand by the Lebanese people. And we are committed to do everything possible to help them overcome their challenges. We are ready to support a comprehensive reform program that restores macroeconomic stability and public trust. My remarks: \n\nhttps://t.co/zsKXEO6ias'

b'Three key issues for the financial system:

1\xe2\x83\xa3 Greater risk taking in an environment of lower interest rates.
2\xe2\x83\xa3 While the financial system remains strong, there are weak banks, especially in emerging markets.
3\xe2\x83\xa3 Non-bank financial institutions remain unfinished business.'

b'Decisive reforms after the financial crisis made the financial system stronger. This serves us well today. But we cannot take financial stability for granted. Work must go on to build more resilience for the future.\n \nGood conversation w/@martinwolf_ at the #FTBanking summit! https://t.co/B4dcNIgKFw'
b'My condolences for the loss of your grandfather @JaredCohen - may he Rest In Peace. https://t.co/M0zfAz5cje'

b'Learning from this pandemic is critical if we want to be more resilient in the face of future shocks - and build a better world.\n \nPleased to host an insightful discussion with @FareedZakaria today on the lessons of this crisis for inequality, technology, climate, and more! https://t.co/8qWcccto1w'

b'Looking forward to my conversation with @martinwolf_ at the #FTBanking Summit on Dec. 2 at 8:20am. A great chance to discuss how financial & banking systems managed during #COVID19 and how to foster their resilience. https://t.co/rVLR3JcvP5 https://t.co/PYKnkWko7H'

b'Corruption hurts the most vulnerable in society. 

At a time when so many are suffering in this crisis, it keeps children out of school and the sick from getting treatment.
 
We must take the fight against it to heart! My remarks today at #IACC2020. https://t.co/x0xa0cqpbs https://t.co/129A5MIOYG'

b'Tomorrow I\xe2\x80\x99ll discuss the actions the IMF is taking to help countries fight #corruption during the crisis and beyond with @anticorruption #IACC2020 https://t.co/IxWb4aV37G https://t.co/3tGChEr2tc'

b'It is important to look at the lessons from history to #BuildForwardBetter.\n\n@FareedZakaria\xe2\x80\x99s new book \xe2\x80\x9cTen Lessons for a Post-Pandemic World\xe2\x80\x9d is a stimulating read and I look forward to our conversation on this topic tomorrow at 11:00 AM EST. https://t.co/8VkdUYE3bc https://t.co/857iPa7TcB'

b'News on vaccines is promising but uncertainty is still high and a new wave of #COVID19 weakens recovery in the #euroarea. Continued policy support is vital until durable exit from the health crisis. Both fiscal and monetary policy have a role to play. https://t.co/cFM1L9Gajb https://t.co/IUNa3tly4d'

b'What will we need to help low-income countries through this crisis?\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
First,\xc2\xa0address unsustainable debt.
\xc2\xa0
Second, provide strong financial support.
\xc2\xa0
And finally: promote growth through investment and revitalizing global trade.
https://t.co/TwLnIeakFz'

b'Sadly, it is low-income countries and their people who will pay the highest price in this pandemic. To overcome the crisis and strengthen their resilience for the future, they need more help now. My op-ed with @SigridKaag in @ProSyn. https://t.co/TwLnIeakFz'

b'Best wishes to all who celebrate #Thanksgiving. This holiday I send my thanks & prayers for the health workers who risk their lives to protect ours, for all 190 IMF member countries for coming together in this crisis, and for the amazing IMF staff for their tireless service. https://t.co/4T9QHS6g2O'

b'Jim Wolfensohn was the voice of vulnerable people & a champion of their rights. He inspired the @WorldBank to dream of a world free of poverty \xe2\x80\x94 & work to make this dream a reality.  I am proud he was my friend, boss & mentor, and deeply mourn his loss. https://t.co/yI6pratXlV https://t.co/oe5Qrk4Lmj'

b'Met President @moisejovenel and his economic team to discuss the challenges facing #Haiti in the wake of #COVID19 and what more can be done to help the Haitian people through this crisis. https://t.co/UtcGughTQE'

b'Monetary policy cannot do the job alone \xe2\x80\x93 fiscal support for businesses and workers is vital until we exit the health crisis. Financial stability risks must also be managed. #LowerforLonger https://t.co/9IrNdHjbey'

b'Important discussion on central banking with Carolyn Wilkins, @RichardClarida, Philip Lane & Tobias Adrian. In this \xe2\x80\x9clow for long\xe2\x80\x9d era, central banks must be innovative & bold to update their toolkits & find new ammunition to support the recovery. https://t.co/Z6wOj7uoJN https://t.co/B9BjTBCpMf'

b'At a #China 1+6 roundtable, I emphasized: to end this crisis, countries need to work together, including by ensuring effective vaccines & treatments are available for everyone. Global leaders should focus on three key areas: #debt, #trade & #climatechange https://t.co/pY8XgNHqAy https://t.co/fWSdpUeyqv'
b'Thank you @europeaid \xf0\x9f\x87\xaa\xf0\x9f\x87\xba! Your contribution to debt relief frees precious life saving resources in 29 poorest countries. https://t.co/CsMFm3M8B0'

b'The Fund is here to help. During the crisis, we\xe2\x80\x99ve provided $14B in support to 7 Arab countries & we provided $42M in debt service relief to 3 Arab countries. And we are ready to do more.'

b'Today at the Arab Fiscal Forum, I applauded Arab countries for their swift & strong response to #COVID19. To sustain vital lifelines, countries will need to boost revenues once the recovery is well underway & make spending more efficient. https://t.co/IfYZTW8Um6 https://t.co/6Hqn6J0e9w'

b'Thank you to the European Union for their generous contribution of \xe2\x82\xac183 mln to our Catastrophe Relief Fund; a critical step to help the world\xe2\x80\x99s most vulnerable countries provide health care and economic support at the time of #COVID19. I encourage other countries to contribute. https://t.co/gcZ8eP6kyD'

b'This crisis has demonstrated the great value of learning from the lessons of the past \xe2\x80\x93 and applying them to build resilience to future shocks. My remarks @IMF_Tokyo \xe2\x80\x93 @UTokyo_News conference on securing financial stability. https://t.co/LVa1lkq2dP https://t.co/HlF330QCJM'

b'At the #G20 Summit I emphasized three priorities: ending the health crisis everywhere; building a bridge to recovery via a synchronized investment push\xe2\x80\x94focus on green and digital; laying the foundation for a more inclusive and sustainable global economy. https://t.co/MdRspNmkP0 https://t.co/7x7eSdz4qt'

b'This weekend\xe2\x80\x99s #G20 Leaders\xe2\x80\x99 Summit endorsed the Common Framework for debt - now the most vulnerable countries can apply for permanent debt relief with a level playing field for creditors. We must immediately move to implementation. https://t.co/Mkjz1zTuWC https://t.co/A1fmPTEP05'

b'Great conversation w/@ian_goldin today at the #StatsForum on how timely data, statistics & factual information help policymakers navigate the pandemic. This crisis has highlighted the need for transformation to build more inclusive & sustainable societies. https://t.co/zGUn2bFWAY https://t.co/PtM68p16BE'

b"Congrats to @WTO on their 25th anniversary. As it\xe2\x80\x99s said, \xe2\x80\x9cSticks in a bundle are unbreakable\xe2\x80\x9d, which is representative of the incredible strength of multilateralism and WTO's role in promoting more open & stable global trade. Together we can #buildforwardbetter. https://t.co/aEWcaZqZZt"

b'Global public debt is at a record-high and we at the IMF are working with our partners and taking action to help countries, case-by-case, with heavy debt burdens. https://t.co/793IfoDS4h #OurNewEconomy https://t.co/3vExULPSdi'

b"At Bloomberg's @neweconforum, I was asked about my main message for the G20 Leaders Summit this weekend. It is this: Let\xe2\x80\x99s work together & do not withdraw support for people & economies until the pandemic is in the rear-view mirror. https://t.co/gQVgBYN2XU"

b'Stronger international cooperation on #vaccines is critical to defeat the pandemic and boost the economic recovery. Faster progress on widely shared medical solutions could add almost $9 trillion to global income by 2025. #IMFBlog #G20 https://t.co/NRWO5pSgOU https://t.co/OHRnYxfxqq'

b'Thank you, @MikeBloomberg, Ruth Porat & @IanBremmer for the thoughtful conversation on the challenges ahead in building #OurNewEconomy. The IMF is assisting our 190 member countries to overcome this crisis & build a better post-pandemic economy. https://t.co/Rlbhq8AlAA'

b"Looking forward to my conversation with my colleague @ian_goldin at the #StatsForum. The pandemic has caused much loss but also provided an opportunity to learn. We will discuss the importance of data issues & challenges caused by the pandemic, & lessons for the int'l community. https://t.co/Tq6KEUIlgA"

b'IMF research shows large potential GDP gains when #G20 countries invest at the same time. We should prepare for a synchronized infrastructure investment push that can build the impetus for growth, jobs, and address #climatechange.  #IMFBlog https://t.co/YX30qCt5ex'

b'My key message ahead of the #G20 Leaders\xe2\x80\x99 Summit: We need strong policy action to combat high economic and financial uncertainty. Success depends on us acting swiftly, and acting together. Read my new blog:  https://t.co/793IfoDS4h https://t.co/iS0tc2OHbu'

b'Public & private sectors are key players in the pandemic recovery process. Looking forward to #OurNewEconomy Forum with @MikeBloomberg, Ruth Porat & @IanBremmer on how these sectors can work better together to ensure economic benefits for all people & future generations. https://t.co/MTg5haQOJ2'

b'Honored to be listed among @Winnie_Byanyima, @jacindaardern, @Lagarde, and @DrTedros in this year\xe2\x80\x99s #LinkedInTopVoices. I am fortunate to be able to use my voice to make a difference in the world. https://t.co/h1J3ZVGcH7 https://t.co/fvDnMPV9tB'
b'Constructive call with President @ZelenskyyUa on IMF program implementation, central bank independence and anti-corruption efforts. Full agreement on actions needed prior to program review.'

b'We welcome the historic trade agreement in the #AsiaPacific region. The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (#RCEP) brings together ASEAN, Australia, China, Japan, New Zealand and South Korea to promote high employment and sustainable economic growth.'

b'I was delighted to meet with my friend Luhut Panjaitan, Indonesia\xe2\x80\x99s Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs & Investment. We discussed Indonesia\xe2\x80\x99s courageous efforts to overcome the pandemic & orient its economy toward the future\xe2\x80\x94greener, digital, w/ vibrant small businesses.'
b'@BragaMerighetti No, I have not sent any requests to you - must be coming from a false account.'

b'Exceptional times require exceptional action. Our latest Annual Report shows how the IMF and our member countries are working to protect people, safeguard the economy, & prepare for a recovery that benefits all. Read about how we have swung into action. https://t.co/iJLa4Jn2Ot https://t.co/e8qd9GEEx1'

b'[2/2] I was also delighted to congratulate the World Food Program again for its very well-deserved Nobel Peace Prize. Every day, the brave and tireless work of @WFP and its staff brings hope to millions who suffer the cruelty of hunger. Bravo!'

b'[1/2] Pleased to join UN Secretary General @antonioguterres and other multilateral leaders today at the World Food Program Executive Board meeting. In this pandemic, strong cooperation among international organizations is critical! https://t.co/LBGtlP7R20'
b'RT @IMFLive: Today, @KGeorgieva @antonioguterres @WFPChief @DavidMalpassWBG @JuttaUrpilainen & others join together to ensure a collaborati\xe2\x80\xa6'
b'My very best wishes for a happy #Diwali today to all who celebrate!  May this beautiful festival of lights mark the beginning of a joyful year. https://t.co/nkqGlVIWGF'

b'It was a pleasure to be hosted in Paris by President @EmmanuelMacron for the #ParisPeaceForum2020 and the #FinanceinCommon2020! A great opportunity to work with him and global leaders on ways to overcome the crisis while building a more inclusive, smart and resilient world. https://t.co/jXx1vDLyWP'

b'Bravo to @RiouxRemy for bringing together public development banks for the first ever #FinanceinCommon2020 summit! Pleased to hear about investments in digital infrastructure, clean energy, and skills of tomorrow while supporting transparency good governance. https://t.co/cYpmlR18wf'

b"Very productive meeting w/ @BrunoLeMaire on the global economy, prospects for green recovery, France\xe2\x80\x99s response to COVID-19 and support to Africa & the Middle East. We also discussed the newly adopted G20 Common Framework for Debt Treatment & the IMF's role in its implementation. https://t.co/ibj8oCVudP"

b'I thanked French President @EmmanuelMacron at the @Elysee for his commitment to multilateralism and on the successful @ParisPeaceForum2020. We also discussed France\xe2\x80\x99s response to the crisis, its support for Africa and the prospect for urgent economic reforms in #Lebanon. https://t.co/hkARfZ2Jy4'

b'Today\xe2\x80\x99s #G20 agreement on a common framework for debt treatments is a critical step to help low-income countries with unsustainable debt get the support they need to focus on fighting the pandemic and investing in their people. https://t.co/DxmWGniisr https://t.co/yhp7boEsjs'

b'Recovering from the current crisis requires determined collective action, both domestically and globally. Our main message is this: do not withdraw fiscal and monetary policy support prematurely! My remarks at the #CaixinSummit: https://t.co/wnlkcE5Hlf https://t.co/VTL8qAzBi8'

b'Big thanks to @EmmanuelMacron and @RiouxRemy for convening #FinanceinCommon2020 to discuss the important role of development banks in the recovery \xe2\x80\x93 it is vital to invest where it matters the most \xe2\x80\x93 digital infrastructure, clean energy and skills for the jobs of tomorrow. https://t.co/odVHciZMmk'

b'We also discussed the support from the IMF. I am very pleased that we could come fast to back up the actions of the President. We need to continue to seek ways to boost investments and make sure that there is liquidity to generate growth and jobs in the years to come. https://t.co/5yRN4ry89Y'

b'Pleased to meet with President @Macky_Sall at #ParisPeaceForum today. I commended him on the bold steps taken to contain the pandemic, provide economic support, and strive for inclusive growth for all the Senegalese people. #IMFAfrica https://t.co/bgyri6qCxO'
b'[4/4] Read my remarks at the 2020 #ParisPeaceForum: https://t.co/FR6uWHXER0 https://t.co/83hRW95hxd'

b'[3/4] Point 3: As we act collectively, we ought to think of what we leave to future generations. It cannot be that we load them with unsustainable debt. It cannot be that we miss out on greening their future. Where needed, we should deal with debt early on a case-by-case basis.'

b'[2/4] Point 2: We must not forget the developing world. We must make sure they have liquidity and investment. The risk of deepening inequality and losing what we have achieved in the fight against poverty is very real. IMF is committed to helping.'

b'[1/4] @ParisPeaceForum, my COVID econ response points. 1: need strong, coordinated public high-quality investment push to lift growth, address climate, & promote digitalization. G20 nations investing at same time could spend 1/3rd less to achieve the same outcome vs acting alone.'
b'RT @ParisPeaceForum: #ParisPeaceForum2020: \xe2\x80\x9cIs 2021 going to be a year in which we write yet another Tale of Two Cities? Or will 2021 be a\xe2\x80\xa6'

b'Together we can overcome this crisis and build a more resilient world! I look forward to joining @EmmanuelMacron and other leaders at the @ParisPeaceForum! https://t.co/9tU8Ata3OV https://t.co/Y86U9hrJfh'

b'Today, for the first time, the IMF approved financial assistance for #SouthSudan. The US$52.2 million from the Fund will significantly help mitigate the impact of the pandemic on the people of South Sudan. https://t.co/gJ7AYdPCZA'

b'How do we #BuildForwardBetter post-#COVID19? Join me tomorrow at the @ParisPeaceForum where we will discuss how to build a more inclusive and resilient post-pandemic world. https://t.co/WoFwOrILbg #ParisPeaceForum2020'

b'In this pandemic, while we will continue to face challenges ahead, we must plan for a better future. In the words of Vietnam\xe2\x80\x99s great epic poem, The Tale of Kieu: Thank heaven we are here today, to see the sun through parting fog and clouds. \nMy remarks: https://t.co/ffmbHne6cE https://t.co/oHMdL0Cns8'
b'Our chief economist \xe2\x81\xa6@GitaGopinath is right on the mark: \xe2\x80\x9cGoing forward, the world has to be one that is less unequal\xe2\x80\x9d.  So proud of her!  https://t.co/MuQcXLhDEU'

b'To win the fight against #climatechange, we also must harness the power of the financial sector. We need policies that nurture sustainable finance and mobilize funds for #greeninvestments. This was my message at the #GHS2020 on the road to #COP26. https://t.co/QNsPlyhbFo https://t.co/WOsb01GQEw'
b'I briefed the meeting on the status of the global economy, the impact of #COVID19, and the policy priorities for a green, resilient & inclusive economic recovery.'
b"More important than ever to work together - pleased to join @antonioguterres and the @UN System Chief Executives Board for Coordination in today's virtual session. @DavidMalpassWBG @mbachelet"

b'Climate-related disasters pose countless challenges to the global economy. Delighted to open the discussion on policy responses to these risks with IMF\xe2\x80\x99s Sayeh, @UN\xe2\x80\x99s Mark Carney, and @YaleEconomics\xe2\x80\x99 William Nordhaus at the #ARCPolak conference today. https://t.co/ZK1TZlUFFa https://t.co/5Fsl35KIqD'
b'RT @GitaGopinath: My @FT op-ed: For the first time, in 60% of the global economy, 97% of advanced economies, central banks policy interest\xe2\x80\xa6'

b'One of my takeaways from our recent Annual Meetings: A very strong alignment among our membership on the understanding that this is a crisis like no other and requires a response like no other. #CGDTalks #IMFmeetings https://t.co/KPWD51ZFJ0'
b'The recovery from this crisis is a once in a lifetime opportunity to support a transformation in the economy. A greener, smarter, and fairer economy. #CGDTalks https://t.co/NltFJc3P7v'

b'2021 is going to be a very important year for the world, and it comes with a great responsibility for the IMF to play its role. Thank you @MasoodCGD and @CGDev for the opportunity to share our views on the path towards recovery. https://t.co/PgMiOeEJIo'

b'The IMF has a significant role to play in helping to shape the recovery from the pandemic. Looking forward to my conversation with @CGDev President @MasoodCGD on this and other key topics on the path towards a smarter, greener & fairer future. \nJoin us: https://t.co/MVdvdod6Yf https://t.co/TlxdBqnudA'

b"We face a long ascent\xe2\x80\x94difficult, uneven, uncertain. How can we fight this crisis today & build a better tomorrow? Join me and @MasoodCGD for a #CGDtalks on the IMF's role in helping to shape the recovery & policy priorities going forward \xe2\x80\x93 Friday, Oct. 30 https://t.co/GpixSWElcX https://t.co/csTvY9rcqw"

b'Pleased to welcome @MauricioPozoEC of #Ecuador to discuss how best to further strengthen our engagement and ensure the success of Ecuador\xe2\x80\x99s IMF-supported economic program, which aims to improve the lives of all Ecuadorians. https://t.co/szRElAv8eZ'

b'My main message today at the press briefing on the #UK 2020 Article IV Consultation is that continued policy support is essential to address the pandemic and to sustain and invigorate a recovery. \nhttps://t.co/2Jp9F8m9CA https://t.co/Zvp2yNy5tL'

b"IMF staff's preliminary annual review of the #UK economy recognizes the government's enormous efforts to contain #COVID19's impact. We recommend sustaining fiscal policy support for people & firms, supporting the recovery w public investment, and accommodative monetary policy. https://t.co/psKW4qlz5T"
b'RT @IMFNews: IMF Chief @KGeorgieva and @CGDev President @MasoodCGD will host a #CGDTalks to discuss the outcomes of the Annual #IMFmeetings\xe2\x80\xa6'

b'Bold domestic policy actions and international cooperation to fight #climatechange - full alignment with @PEspinosaC @UNFCCC Exec Secretary on what needs to be done. #COP26 provides an important opportunity to accelerate progress towards a climate resilient future.'

b'We must promote policies that restore trust in multilateralism. The pandemic has taught us we are in this together, and we can only get out of it together. #B20Summit @B20 https://t.co/5GyJlQWu2d https://t.co/hgd8Gfycpq'

b'Thank you @GCC finance ministers and central bank governors for an excellent discussion yesterday on economic policy priorities in the region and how to #BuildForwardBetter for all the region\xe2\x80\x99s people. My full remarks: https://t.co/vLULZQTn7a https://t.co/2JxY8U0ltZ'

b'A great conversation today about the need for multilateralism, its challenges, and innovative ways of working together at the #B20Summit. Thank you @OfficeGSBrown, @robertocazevedo, @DrMukhisaKituyi, @smindrawatii, and @gilliantett. @b20 https://t.co/5GyJlQWu2d https://t.co/CZezGjyPT6'

b'Tomorrow I\xe2\x80\x99ll discuss global solutions for the recovery & how to build forward better with business leaders from around the world at the #B20SaudiArabia Summit. Join me at 10:20 am EDT. @B20 https://t.co/JmWuvaysT5'

b'Very useful discussion with Gulf Cooperation Council (@GCC) fin min and bank govs on the region\xe2\x80\x99s swift policy response to the pandemic crisis and how to diversify regional economies & create new opportunities for all their people. Reforms already in place give GCC a head start. https://t.co/mhjHVjfWZ5'

b'Today I had a very productive meeting with fin min & central bank govs from the Caucasus & Central Asia (CCA) on the pandemic\xe2\x80\x99s social and economic impact on the region. The IMF stands ready to support CCA countries on their path to building more resilient & inclusive economies. https://t.co/SEnAAxxQwY'

b"Very good discussion with @bancodeportugal\xe2\x80\x99s Governor M\xc3\xa1rio Centeno. #Portugal's effective and swift response to dampen the economic impact of #COVID19 provides a solid foundation for recovery."

b'COVID-19 disproportionally affects women\xe2\x80\x94we need to strengthen policies to support them through the crisis. Put more money in the hands of women to build a sustainable and inclusive recovery for all. Pls watch my interview with @AnnetteF24: https://t.co/6QO7BKhAcR'

b'Central banks around the world, including in emerging markets, have acted decisively to maintain financial stability during this worst economic crisis of our lifetime. But when it comes to financial risks, we cannot lower our guard. https://t.co/TJCP2WZ9Y8 https://t.co/zT1GSNGmWR'

b'I had a great exchange today with Austrian @oenb\xe2\x80\x99s Governor Robert Holzmann on the pandemic, including #Austria\xe2\x80\x99s contributions to our resources, as well. I thanked him for their strong support to the #JointViennaInstitute, and hosting our Western Balkan Regional Office. https://t.co/JENfS6bGJS'

b'Today, we have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to tackle #ClimateChange and build forward better toward a more resilient, inclusive world after the crisis. My @TIME interview with @JustinWorland: https://t.co/I9kWeTuucV'

b'Excellent virtual panel with Central, Eastern, and Southeastern European ministers and governors on what is needed to overcome the dire impact of #COVID19 and secure the recovery. We remain deeply committed to supporting their efforts. https://t.co/GGKngijAWW'

b'COVID-19 threatens to undo years of development progress in sub-Saharan Africa, and the region faces a difficult road to recovery. The IMF is supporting countries in the region by rapidly deploying extraordinary emergency financing -- and stands ready to do more! https://t.co/BHz9qodZRT'

b'Great exchange with Ivoirien PM @HamedBakayoko1 this afternoon. Congratulated him on his country\xe2\x80\x99s COVID-19 response & discussed the need to strengthen the economy & ensure a robust economic recovery for all. https://t.co/F5MMHmIgHg'

b'Thank you #ASEAN ministers and governors for an excellent discussion today! A pleasure to reaffirm our close partnership as we work together to fight the crisis today and build forward better for tomorrow. https://t.co/UKzQSzKcet'

b'I had a great conversation with @PrannoyRoyNDTV @ndtv about the impact the pandemic is having on India\xe2\x80\x99s and the global economy\xe2\x80\x94and the path towards a greener, smarter and more inclusive recovery. My full interview: https://t.co/L8J4xmjPa2'

b'Excellent call with @DNB_NL\xe2\x80\x99s Governor @KlaasKnot. We discussed the Netherlands\xe2\x80\x99 strong response to the pandemic and how green investments are an important part of the recovery. https://t.co/esX5vS1mzz'

b'With today\xe2\x80\x99s approval of $156 million, we have provided a total of $382 million to address the hardships COVID-19 has brought on Cameroon\xe2\x80\x99s people, economy and health system. https://t.co/FoM2OgKpN7'

b'I had a productive call with Pakistan\xe2\x80\x99s Advisor to PM on Finance @a_hafeezshaikh & @StateBank_Pak Gov @DRezaBaqir. The govt\xe2\x80\x99s policy response & support from the int\xe2\x80\x99l community helped mitigate the impact of #COVID19. Further reforms are needed to build a more resilient economy. https://t.co/yOez9F2FLd'

b'Great event with the MENA, Afghanistan, & Pakistan finance ministers & central bank govs on how to support a robust recovery & create sustainable jobs for the youth of the region. The IMF has provided $15 billion of new financing to the region and looks forward to help as needed. https://t.co/6h2P7ehYGo'
b'I congratulated him on Korea\xe2\x80\x99s strong response to the pandemic. It is of great interest for countries around the world to benefit from Korea\xe2\x80\x99s experience.'
b'I had a productive conversation with South Korea Deputy PM Hong Nam-ki today to discuss the international community\xe2\x80\x99s efforts to help the most vulnerable countries.'

b'I had a very good conversation today with Governor Mario Marcel of Chile\xe2\x80\x99s central bank (@bcentralchile), and took the opportunity to congratulate him and his staff for the excellent work undertaken during these unprecedented times to help #Chile overcome the crisis. https://t.co/OHZeoABz1p'

b'The public sector is doing what it can to help prevent another banking crisis from happening again. Banks and shareholders have both an interest and an obligation to do the same. https://t.co/cQfPQtCdVg'

b'The time has also come to update the stress tests bank supervisors use to determine whether \xe2\x80\x94 and by how much \xe2\x80\x94 payouts should be restricted. International coordination is key to ensure consistency, and the IMF and @FinStbBoard can help. https://t.co/cQfPQtCdVg'
b'It is also very important to act collectively. No bank can do it alone, and if banks\xe2\x80\x99 collective will is not there, then supervisors should act. https://t.co/cQfPQtCdVg'

b'Preserving capital now does not mean bank shareholders will not be paid. Rather, payments should be suspended until we are out of this recession. The interests of shareholders, bank supervisors, and customers are all aligned. https://t.co/cQfPQtCdVg'

b'Why? Last year, 30 global banks distributed about $250bn in dividends and share buybacks. We are now in a recession and only see a partial recovery in 2021.  Banks retaining earnings can help stabilize the economy. https://t.co/cQfPQtCdVg'

b'This week, I called on banks to temporarily halt the payment of dividends and share buybacks as we weather this crisis. This is a time to preserve capital. https://t.co/cQfPQtCdVg https://t.co/CUGxrmuPPD'
